intro: Cyphostemma labatii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by yellow, fleshy berries. Cyphostemma labatii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
